intro: Tetragastris mucronata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed tetragastris, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants such as the cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically elliptical and have a smooth or slightly toothed margin. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in racemes, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible. The botanical features of Tetragastris mucronata make it an important species in tropical ecosystems.
